attributes.action: enable members of the public to bring prosecutions against police chief constables who fail in their duties to protect the public from anti-social behaviour
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition requests that the Prime Minister enables ordinary citizens to bring prosecutions against the Chief Inspector of a police force, where it is alleged that the Inspector has been criminally negligent in his failure to ensure that the ordinary citizen is adequately protected from anti-social behaviour. 

Aggravating factors included in the prosecution decision may include the death or serious injury of a citizen who has repeatedly reported anti-social behaviour, evidence of reports not being taken seriously, evidence that the anti-social behaviour has been continuing for a prolonged period without improvement or action and so on.

The aim of the prosecution is to ensure that the leadership of the police forces are personally committed to ensuring that the police force deals with serious issue of anti-social behaviour as it arises and uses the full force of the law to ensure that ordinary citizens are protected in their home environment.
